reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: SETTING UP SUSTAINABLE HARVEST MODELS OF MANGROVE ECOSYSTEMS IN MADAGASCAR

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award To extend Forest Service efforts to improve forest policies and practices internationally, address climate change, conserve and protect critical global forest environments and resources, and improve the lives of forest-dependent peoples by awarding grants to and entering into cooperative agreements with nonprofit organizations, multilateral organizations, and other individuals, organizations, institutions, and governments engaged in forest conservation and management..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: The U.S. government seeks to help Madagascar consolidate its democratic gains and begin addressing the root causes of poverty, which leave it ranked as one of the poorest countries in the world. According to the World Bank, more than 92 percent of Madagascar's population survives on less than two dollars a day and 77 percent live in extreme poverty. U.S. assistance will provide support in the areas of environment, democracy and good governance, and peace and security. Continued investments in health and food security activities will build upon successes and accelerate progress towards ending preventable child and maternal deaths, preventing malaria, as well as promoting a stable, resilient Malagasy society.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: State and Private Forestry, Forest Service
